text:
Good you have been keeping busy.
Feedback wise , and keep in mind that animation is my strong point and not texture work:

First  tiles seem fine but I'm unsure we why they are offset like that. I have filed before and that's not how they looks when crooked,  probably needs to be all straight or a bit crooked in all  axis. 

Nice damage on tiles. Blue grout is a bit odd but if that's the colour u like then that's cool. Grout needs damage and stains like the rest of the tile. Check references,  it's the first part to get dirty.

The last one looks smooth. I'd think about what they are made of and why they look and aged this way.

Reference is key . You really need to look at the real world examples and try and copy the bits you like, their shape, colour,  texture,  how they fall off , how the light falls on them and bounces off. The more of that stuff you consider I think the better your work will look.

Great you have been working hard ! Keep it up !

For the first tile is base on my actual bathroom tiles... Would I need to actually have a reference image with my portfolio? The blue isnt grout it is metal frames... Should I try to make it more obvious? And the final one I will try and give it more grundge however I want to keep it more stylised rather than realistic.

No need to show reference unless they match exactly , I think. 
I think they also look odd wrapped around  a sphere,  feels unnatural for titles.
